abstract: The world’s largest retailer still expects to add jobs at its New York apparel office and at its sales outlets.
snippet: The world’s largest retailer still expects to add jobs at its New York apparel office and at its sales outlets.
lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart Stores, the nation’s largest retailer and a rare bright star in the grim retailing universe, said Tuesday that it planned to cut 700 to 800 jobs at its headquarters in Bentonville, Ark., as it made broad changes to its operations.

headline.main: Wal-Mart to Cut 700 to 800 Jobs at Headquarters
headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart to Trim 700 Jobs at Headquarters
